name: Johannes Gutenberg
bio: Invented movable-type printing press around 1440 in Mainz. His Gutenberg Bible revolutionized knowledge dissemination, education, and the spread of ideas across Europe.

name: Carl Benz
bio: Patented the Benz Patent-Motorwagen in 1886, the world's first production automobile. Founded Benz & Cie., which later merged to form Mercedes-Benz.

name: Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen
bio: Discovered X-rays in 1895 at the University of Würzburg. Awarded the first Nobel Prize in Physics (1901). His discovery transformed medical diagnostics.

name: Rudolf Diesel
bio: Invented the diesel engine in the 1890s. His compression-ignition engine became fundamental to transportation, shipping, and industry worldwide.

name: Albert Einstein
bio: Developed the theory of relativity (E=mc²). Nobel Prize in Physics (1921). His work reshaped our understanding of space, time, and energy.

name: Gottlieb Daimler
bio: Pioneered high-speed internal combustion engines. Co-founded Daimler-Motoren-Gesellschaft. His innovations laid the foundation for modern automobiles.

name: Wilhelm Maybach
bio: Collaborated with Daimler on engine development. Designed the first Mercedes (1901). Later founded Maybach-Motorenbau, known for luxury vehicles.

name: Hugo Junkers
bio: Built the first all-metal aircraft (Junkers J 1, 1915). Pioneered cantilever wing design. His innovations advanced aviation engineering.

name: Werner von Siemens
bio: Founded Siemens AG. Invented the electric generator and developed the first electric elevator. Key figure in electrification of industry.

name: Max Planck
bio: Father of quantum theory. Introduced Planck's constant. Nobel Prize in Physics (1918). His work laid the foundation for modern quantum mechanics.

name: Konrad Zuse
bio: Built the Z3 (1941), the world's first programmable computer. Developed the first high-level programming language (Plankalkül).

name: Ferdinand Porsche
bio: Designed the Volkswagen Beetle and founded Porsche. His engineering philosophy emphasized performance, efficiency, and innovation.
